facts: Canberra is the capital of Australia, chosen as a compromise between Sydney and Melbourne.
Brasilia became Brazil's capital in 1960 and was planned and built as a modern city.
Washington, D.C. is the capital of the United States and is not part of any state.
Tokyo is the capital of Japan and is one of the most populated urban areas in the world.
Ottawa is the capital of Canada and sits on the Ottawa River between Ontario and Quebec.
Pretoria is one of South Africa's three capital cities and is the center of its executive government.
Vatican City is the smallest independent country in the world, and its capital is Vatican City itself.
